salesLead.name: Zoe Nolan
salesLead.summary:
I am a software engineering leader with over 15 years of diverse experience ranging from low-level hardware to cloud services, microservices, big data and Blockchain development. My prior work includes wholesale banking settlement platforms at Clearmatics, building web scale messaging platforms at Skype and development of real-time video encoders, GPU architecture, and game engines.  

My career has included experience in architecting and building new products,  designing and promoting adoption of development processes, leading Scrum teams, building teams, and representing my employers through public speaking and community involvement.

In addition to my experience, I hold an MSc in Computer Graphics & Virtual Environments and a BSc in Software Engineering from The University of Hull. I am a Certified Scrum Master and have taken several courses and programs with Open University, Coursera, and FutureLearn. I’m also an Organising Team Member for Rails Girls London and a Mentor for She(256), an organisation dedicated to diversity in Blockchain.
salesLead.title: Chief Technology Officer
salesLead.titleDescription:
Zien is a commissioning platform that collaborates with the world's most original artists to produce NFTs with redeemable physical artwork. Hands-on bootstrapping the chatbot and NFT platforms

• Developed a scalable Natural Language Processing (NLP) chatbot platform using TypeScript. Initially integrated the platform with WhatsApp and later expanded its functionality to include support for Telegram.
• Utilising a hybrid approach, combining a rules-based system to handle specific details and an LLM to provide general knowledge and conversational capabilities. 
• Integrated the chatbot platform with external APIs allowing the bot to perform tasks on the user's behalf.
• Constructed an NFT platform on the Ethereum blockchain in Solidity, Hardhat, and TypeScript. The platform enables the trading and ownership of digital assets with a physical component. 
• Coordinating and overseeing external contractors. Ensured effective communication, task delegation, and timely delivery of contracted work.

I advise the CEO on Strategic Planning, Product and Market Validation, Risk Management with a focus on software development.

Swarm is a licensed high-liquidity DeFi protocol. Lead the engineering function comprises a mix of internal and multiple external teams.

• Functioned as a delivery manager in launching the world's first regulated DeFi platform. Led the successful launch of the industry's pioneering decentralised finance platform. 
• Architected the initial move to a layer two solution. Managed the move to Polygon and the reuse of the existing infrastructure. 
• Developed a robust reporting system using Python and the Etherscan API. Enabled comprehensive analysis of trades executed on the DeFi platform, providing valuable insights and reporting capabilities.
• Designed and executed the company's hiring process, including screening interviews. Developed an effective hiring process to attract and evaluate qualified candidates. Conducted screening interviews to assess candidates' suitability for various roles within the company.
• Established standardised development methods and best practices company-wide.

Global Parametrics is a commercial, social venture using big data to provide parametric insurance to low- and middle-income countries. 

• Developed and implemented a webhook-based notification system integration with Ethereum-based insurance providers, serving as an oracle providing weather event data to Solidity smart contracts.
• Building out serverless APIs in Python, PostgreSQL, and Big Query on GCP to support the pricing of parametric insurance products.
• Serving as a delivery manager across the company, working to improve processes. 
• Designed the development process and coached teams across the company in Scrum and Agile best practices.
• Delivered automated CI/CD pipelines across the product portfolio using GitHub Actions.

Clearmatics is a Blockchain R&D company focused on financial markets. In this role I manage engineering across the company with multiple teams of product development engineers while also providing individual contribution to software projects and lead establishment of processes.

• Delivered the progression framework across the engineering function. The framework was subsequently used as the basis for progression in other departments.
• Architected and built the Digital Cash Network (DCN) product, including the flagship implementation Utility Settlement Coin (USC) and the Asset Token contract core of the DCN system using Go, Python, Docker and Kubernetes for deployment, and contract code in Solidity. Added testing infrastructure around the core contract. 
• Wrote Go-based middleware as part of a microservice architecture to allow simultaneous and consistent access to multiple separate blockchain implementations in the DCN product.
• Represent and evangelise Clearmatics at diverse industry events including meetups and as a mentor at the Chainhack Hackathon and Thomson Reuters HackETHon. Spoke on Blockchain at DevelopHer.
• Developed and ran the company hiring process and screening interviews, doubling the size of the engineering team in four months. 
• Designed company’s development process, coached teams in Scrum and Agile best practices, and served as initial Scrum Master.
• Built a prototype Ethereum-based blockchain pricing engine in Java using OpenGamma using a  deterministic version of OpenGamma to provide consistent floating point results. The finished system was demonstrated at QuantTech 2016.

I was a core member of Skype’s Video for Android team and transitioned to Skype’s Concierge team, serving as scrum master and mentor for multiple engineering groups. My contributions included:

• Developed a support chatbot as part of an internal hackathon which was selected for production. Refined the design and integrated the chatbot with Skype existing support content. Contributed to development of production version built in C# using Orleans on Azure.
• Built Skype Concierge platform as a microservice-based targeted messaging platform in C# on Azure and scaled product to support 500M daily users and multiple simultaneous messaging campaigns. Migrated to the Orleans actor framework and worked in a DevOps model to support the service in production. 
• Started the Media for Skype for TV (audio/video) team to port the next generation C++ video and audio solution to an embedded Linux TV platform, delivering the second non-desktop group video call solution in Skype’s history. Mentored a graduate engineer and served as Scrum Master for UK team collaborating with teams in Palo Alto and Tallinn. 
• First hire for new Video for Android team and delivered the next generation C++ video encode/decode solution to 100M Android users in nine months. Served as Scrum Master for team split between London and Stockholm and collaborated with Moscow and Palo Alto teams.

I was initially hired as a member of 3Dlabs, which was rebranded as ZiiLABS in 2009 and later acquired by Intel in 2012. 

• A real-time H.264 encoder for ZiiLABS media processors running in microcode on the GPU. 
• A machine learning based rate control algorithm to optimise the image quality. 
an optimised hierarchical motion estimator. 
• A high-performance ARM based bitstream encoder.
• A suite of tools for writing, analysing and testing GPU microcode in Perl, Ruby and C++.
• A framebuffer object extension for the OpenGL driver in C/C++.
• A DirectX Windows kernel mode driver in C/C++ to get full WHQL score.
• Ported the existing 2D, DirectX and OpenGL drivers for Windows 64 in C/C++.

I was Lead PlayStation 2 Engineer on ‘The Great Escape’ responsible for gameplay programming in C++, bug triage, and Bugzilla administration. Other work included enhancement of an internal cross-platform game engine in C++ and microcode.

Here I formed the ST200 VLIW codec team and built a prototype MP3 decoder in C, later enhanced to support image resizing. I also ported a JPEG decode library in C to the architecture, worked on new GPU design as a member of the architecture team, built a behavioural model of a GPU in C++ to validate the design, and detailed hardware design for a pixel shader processor in C++. 

I was also responsible for mentoring a graduate engineer and supervising a summer intern.

In this role I created a stack based virtual machine to run point and click adventures in C++ for Windows and PlayStation. Other work included development of a scene graph API, collision detection library and arcade style flight model in C++ for Windows, and SourceSafe and email server administration

Outlook: Scientific Video Protocols (https://scivpro.com) is the first full-open access peer-reviewed video platform publishing in  cinematic quality. We publish high quality research from all areas of natural science and technology.

The core of each protocol is represented by a high quality video shot and edited by professional cinematographers. The open access availability of the video protocol on Youtube facilitates the dissemination of experimental details among the scientific community and the public at large, while promoting authors’ research activities and easing reproducibility of results.

The Youtube video protocol is produced from a manuscript that has passed the quality check and the peer review process. The accepted manuscript is published in our platform (https://scivpro.com) along with the video protocol.

• Wrote proposals for experiments at synchrotron facilities and was awarded £360,000+ in research grants.
• Led collaborative experimental work as principal investigator at ESRF.
• Co-authored 8 peer-reviewed papers in high impact-factor journals (including Energy & Environmental Science, Nature Photonics, and Nature) as principal investigator and co-investigator.
• Helped designing multi-mapping microscopy technique combining 2D Raman spectroscopy, optical microscopy, and 2D photocurrent mapping [J. Mater. Chem. A 6, 23010-23018 (2018)].
• Developed text analytics MATLAB application for automatically processing scientific literature into a machine-readable database. Convinced 15 researchers to join the project.
• Developed novel unsupervised machine learning method for automatically clustering transient photocurrent and photovoltage measurements [Sci. Rep., 8, 5977 (2018)].
• Provided GI-WAXS measurements for a study on perovskites passivation [Nature, 555, 497-501 (2018)] and perovskite-polymer bulk heterostructure LEDs [Nature Photonics, 12, 783-789 (2018)].
• Reviewed manuscripts for 10 high impact-factor journals in a timely and efficient manner (areas of expertise: optics, electronics, X-ray diffraction).
• Delivered weekly presentations online and in-person. 
• Co-authored 10 press release articles for ESRF Highlights, ESRF website, Science News, and University of Warwick website.

• Sourced £780,000+ in research grants for synchrotron experiments.
• Led and co-led collaborative experimental work at synchrotron facilities with own built spectroscopy setups, devices fabrication and opto-electrical characterisation of solar cells.
• Investigated in-situ the crystallization kinetics of organolead halide perovskite films to elucidate how different annealing procedures affect variations in solar cells efficiency [Adv. Funct. Mat. 26, 4934-4942 (2016)]. 
• Discovered grain rotation in perovskite films and developed new pipeline for investigating their texture evolution during thermal annealing [CrystEngComm 18, 5448-5455 (2016)]. 
• Established new MATLAB workflow software for Scanning Nanofocus X-ray Diffraction to simultaneously probe morphology and structural properties of perovskite films for PV devices, allowing to structurally characterise single perovskite grains buried within a polycrystalline matrix, and concluded that spin‐coating precursor solutions at high temperatures led to improved surface coverage and enhanced solar cell performance. [Adv. Funct. Mat. 26, 8221-8230 (2016)]. 
• Led collaboration involving groups from the University of Cambridge and Oxford and contributed to the discovery that metal-halide perovskites show remarkably clean semiconductor behaviour even in the early stages of the anneal despite the presence of structural and chemical defects. [Energy Environ. Sci 11, 383-393 (2018)].
• Expanded the nXRD technique by introducing a third simultaneous measurement, fluorescence spectroscopy, in addition to existing optical microscopy and diffraction measurements, and contributed to the discovery that lattice strain is directly associated with enhanced defect concentrations and non-radiative recombination in perovskite films. [Energy Environ. Sci 12, 596-606 (2019)].
• Trained multiple students and colleagues on experimental best practices and custom software.

• Took care of coated glass R&D (magnetron sputtering, metal oxide and semiconductor layer stack engineering and reverse engineering) and quality control (optical measurements, UV-VIS-NIR, ellipsometry, optical microscopy).
• Managing team of 40 production specialists, ensuring targets are met with a fast turnaround time. 
• Identifying patterns in customer needs.
• Closely interacted with marketing and product management representatives. 

***
Outlook. Guardian is a diversified global manufacturing company with leading positions in float glass, fabricated glass products and other building products for commercial, residential and transportation applications. Through its Science & Technology Centre, Guardian is at the forefront of innovation including development of high performance glass coatings and other advanced products. Guardian, its subsidiaries, and affiliates employ 17,000 people.

• Wrote research proposal for the establishment of own laboratory focusing on 3rd generation photovoltaics and sourced initial £180,000+ to initiate lab construction and £1,200,000+ research grant to further expand lab.
• Wrote 4 proposals as principal and co-investigator with top EU/USA institutes for synchrotron beamtime at ESRF (France) and SLAC (USA) and was awarded £560,000+ research grant to perform experiments.
• Published 10 peer-reviewed papers in high impact factor journals including Nature Photonics [Nature Photonics, 9, 843–848 (2015)].
• Fabricated first organic solar cells in the region and investigated the incorporation of 3D printed luminescent silicon nanoparticles on efficiency of OPVs.
• Installed and serviced equipment (M-Braun glovebox, fume hoods, clean room ventilation system).
• Conceived, designed, supervised the manufacturing, and took care of hardware and software interfacing of new experimental GI-WAXS chamber for synchrotron XRD measurements. The chamber, which allows in-situ and in-operando studies of thin films and electronic devices, is still being used at the BM28 beamline (ESRF) by multiple research groups.
• Taught part of the course of Advanced Solid-State Physics and organised seminars and training courses on devices fabrication and advanced data analysis.
• Wrote 3 press releases for XMaS Newsletter.
• Work on 3D printed solar cells featured 9 times in various newspapers.

Outlook: Masdar Institute was a research-oriented university focussing on alternative energy (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masdar_Institute).

jobs.companyName: Centre national de la recherche scientifique
jobs.description:
• Collaborated on the development of aesthetic inkjet-printed hybrid bulk heterojunction solar cells. 
• Built instrumentation and MATLAB control software to probe light-induced degradation of organic-hybrid organic solar cells (automatic measurements of multiple PV devices).
• Developed simulations of novel silicon solar cells with COMSOL Multiphysics.
• Trained researchers on OPVs fabrication, measurements, and data analysis.
• Took care of the research group outreach (branding, logo, website).

Outlook. The French National Centre for Scientific Research is the largest governmental research organisation in France and the largest fundamental science agency in Europe. It employs 32,000 permanent employees. The CNRS was ranked 3rd in 2015 and 4th in 2017 by the Nature Index worldwide.

• Explored industrially viable OPDs fabrication routes by engineering 1st fully inkjet-printed organic photodiode prototypes using a proof of concept 3D inkjet-printer (DMP-2800 Fujifilm DIMATIX). 3D printing eliminated the need for photodiode patterning as compared to other solution-based fabrication techniques. Current-voltage characteristics were on par with photodiodes fabricated with established solution-based technologies. [Thin Solid Films 520, 610-615 (2011)].
• Performed R&D in a state-of-the-art cleanroom laboratory facility.
• Research duties involved: designing experiments; ITO patterning by photolithography; wet lab processing; preparation of bulk-heterojunction solutions (poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) poly(styrenesulfonate) (P3HT) and phenyl C61 butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM); MBraun glovebox maintenance and operations; thermal evaporation; devices encapsulation; photo-electrical characterisation (solar simulator); films characterisation by profilometry and atomic force microscopy (AFM); inks chemistry formulation and characterisation; analysis, interpretations, and reporting results; communicating results to  broad range of technical and non-technical team members and external collaborators.
• Took care of knowledge transfer and coaching, and trained other researchers on OPD fabrication processes.
• Articulating the connection between potential customer's requirements and prototyping.

*****
Outlook. Siemens AG is a German multinational and the largest industrial manufacturing company in Europe. Siemens employs approximately 385,000 people and in 2019 reported global revenue of around €87 billion.

schools.description:
Completed PhD in 3 years with a thesis titled “Organic Photodetectors Optimization and Nanoscale Investigation” (EPSRC scholarship). 

Characterized P3HT:PCBM films with UPS, XPS, AFM, EFM, and KPFM; developed instrumentation and software for grazing incidence wide angle X-ray scattering (GI-WAXS); established theoretical,  experimental, and software framework for novel Surface Probe Potential Electrostatic Force Microscopy technique.

His major contribution involved clarifying the dynamics of crystallization and the phase segregation mechanisms of BHJ blends during thermal processing, which facilitated the fabrication of improved OPV devices. Between 2010 and 2012 Lilliu co-authored 9 papers in top peer-reviewed journals, collaborated with multiple partners, and trained several scientists on synchrotron measurements and data analysis.

Thesis title: "Neural Networks for the Prevention of Disruptions and Novelty Detection in the Nuclear Fusion."

salesLead.summary:
During my early years and after initially qualifying as a CNC engineer and specialising in sales, I combined these talents to enter the newly emerging technology recruitment sector. Microelectronics and microprocessor/VLSI electronic technology was being designed into every possible human and automated application on the planet. These beginnings took me into technology projects such as medical systems, aircraft and vehicle training simulation systems, air traffic control systems, process control and industrial instrumentation systems, terrestrial, radio and satellite communication systems and so many other domains.

In parallel, I developed a rich connection and network inside the electronic components industry for both manufacturing and distribution. After a career delivering resources to some of the world’s ground breaking projects and cutting edge technologies, the idea to establish a new service business leveraging my past experiences to deliver the highest quality solution emerged. 

As the Founder of Microsolve Electronics Recruitment, my intention is to provide clients with access to the relevant talent pool, delivering the finest resources and providing an immediate and lasting impact on business revenue.
We match candidates precisely in consideration of their personal circumstances and career ambitions. We believe that happy candidates become future clients.

Microsolve Electronics Recruitment operates within the advanced and emerging technologies sectors. We are a specialist recruitment business supporting electronic systems vendors through bespoke talent search services.
We are committed to providing quality in service and delivery whilst maintaining professional ethics and standards. For further information or a confidential conversation, please contact us by phone at 07500-002745 or by email at philip@microsolverecruitment.com

jobs.description:
Prior and during my Directorship, I created an Applied ML Research team and was responsible for product roadmap, architecture, research and development for a news-based ESG controversy engine, covering over 2 million entities, both public and private.

As part of the project our infra consisted of: Terraform for IaC, Kubernetes with pods scaling by HPA, Cloud-build for CI/CD, Secret Manager, Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Google Cloud Storage, Redis, Postgres and Argo workflows for CRON DAG jobs.

A custom MLOps stack was created with: data processing and model training pipelines using BigQuery and Argo K8s workflows, model versioning happening in GCS, experiment tracking in W&B, metadata stored in Postgres, all models converted to ONNX and quantised for better CPU performance, and finally models were deployed through CI/CD with Terraform. Model monitoring were in R&D at the time I left.

On the NLP side, I have extensively worked with and in the majority of cases trained models for: Named Entity Recognition, Sentiment, ESG-relation Classification, Question Answering, Coreference Resolution, POS tagging, Open Information Extraction, Entity Linking, Summarisation and Sentence-level embeddings. I am particularly proud of the novel contextual Entity Linker that was created as part of this project.

As part of my role I mentored junior team members helping them grow their Machine Learning Engineering and NLP skills, alongside elements of project management and presenting. I very much enjoyed empowering them and seeing them excel!

Lead researcher and developer on a few large projects. In particular the whole end-to-end creation of a bespoke ESG scoring model for Dow Jones under the Wall Street Journal brand. The data source being their Factiva news dataset (one of the largest news providers in the world). 

The work includes training in Kubernetes, models stored in GCS, models loaded into worker services with NFS (into docker volumes), Google Pub/Sub with HPA, Transformer models for various types of classification, Coreference resolution, and TF-IDF cosine similarity matching for corporate aliases. 
All the services have Prometheus metrics. 

I created a short-term ESG scoring model for corporate news articles, using the aforementioned technologies/infrastructure. This has been verified to have best-in-class thinking by leading experts in the Sustainability sector. 

On a separate project, I have built a pilot social media sentiment corporate trust score for Accenture based on the Corporate Agility Index Arabesque provide. I have also been a mentor for 3 interns during the course of my time here.

Worked on a large greenfield project - created a range of back-end web-services in C#, dynamic web-pages using ReactJS and communicated the data between layers usingGraphQL. The majority of work has been ’containerised’ using Docker.
Here is a blog post with a more detailed summary of the work I did: http://bit.ly/2YAjPV0

Motivating and facilitating supporters to maximise the l funds they raise; inspiring new supporters to raise money, whilst maintaining and developing relationships with existing supporters; raising awareness of the charity and its work at local and national levels, e.g. by giving talks to groups or seeking photo opportunities with the media; increasing funds by researching and targeting charitable trusts whose criteria match the charity’s aims and activities; as well as writing applications and mail-shots, using direct mailing to reach a wide range of potential and current donors

Led and was responsible for 237 students which were living in the Canterbury Court Hall of residence; managed the hall’s budget for the year and organised large social events including an Easter Ball. Sat on the Senior Students’ Council, where along with the other chairs from halls all over the university we were responsible for 6000 students during Welcome Week and the running of all the Welcome Week events. It also gave me the opportunity to become a Welcome Week Rep on a voluntary basis.

This approach is fundamental to gaining knowledge about the business, understanding people's needs and finding ways to support them in doing their best work.
 
One of the things I enjoy about my job is that it is not just simply changing technology but also changing our approach to it. I take pleasure from working with senior stakeholders and helping to challenge, influence, and support them in solving their most complex problems using technology as a business-enhancing tool. My success is attributable to my ability to combine my business and technical skills and thoroughly understand the company's needs to determine the approach to deliver transformational business & technical solutions. 
 
I am a Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP), and I have a BSc in Mathematics with an endorsement in Computer Science and Informatics. I have also completed the Management Development Programme with the  Gordon Institute of Business Science (GIBS).

general.headline: Digital Transformation | End User Experience | Speaker | Podcaster | Mentor
general.description:
🛠️Helping you to transform your business by leveraging digital technology and tools.

🔥Enabling business people to work anytime, anywhere and on any device.

📈Guiding and building technology-based products for business success!

If you want to discuss these or similar, please get in touch with me directly through LinkedIn.

During my career, I've worked with business leaders to achieve value from technology investments. Adoption is crucial, and to accomplish this, I've spent time listening to and understanding the various needs. I plan the implementation and build solid teams to execute and support a secure adopted solution to get the best outcome for the business users.

This approach is fundamental to gaining knowledge about the business, understanding people's needs and finding ways to support them in doing their best work.
 
One of the things I enjoy about my job is that it is not just simply changing technology but also changing our approach to it. I take pleasure from working with senior stakeholders and helping to challenge, influence, and support them in solving their most complex problems using technology as a business-enhancing tool. My success is attributable to my ability to combine my business and technical skills and thoroughly understand the company's needs to determine the approach to deliver transformational business & technical solutions. 
 
I am a Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP), and I have a BSc in Mathematics with an endorsement in Computer Science and Informatics. I have also completed the Management Development Programme with the  Gordon Institute of Business Science (GIBS).

#CTO #CIO #CISO

salesLead.name: Yasin Kultur
salesLead.summary:
Highly motivated software and AI engineer with experience in architecting, designing, development of enterprise scale software solutions. 15+ years of experience in Development with C#, working knowledge with Microsoft SQL Server, Aurora PostgreSQL (POSTGIS extension), DynamoDB, Redis and other such data stores. Extensive knowledge of design patterns in C# and writing code by following OWASP security standards.  

Strong knowledge in ML algorithms such as Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, N-Gram Analysis, Neural Network and Sequence to Sequence.

Certified AWS Developer and Solutions Architect, fan of Serverless Application Model.

Helped companies to migrate from monolithic architecture hosted on EC2 instances to an event driven service oriented architecture centered around Lambda functions.

Restful API development using AWS Api Gateway with .net core, custom template mappings and infrastructure as a code using cloudformation (SAM) templates. Introduced custom OAUTH mechanism with JWT to enable authorization for stateless calls, customized the mechanism to prevent replay attacks. Also experienced AWS Cognito as authorizer while developing Restful API for my personal projects.

Implemented customer facing JavaScript libraries to render hosted payment page on merchant applications using NodeJS, WebPack, Babel, ES6. Used onpostmessage method to safely enable cross-origin communication between the parent web applications and hosted payment page. AWS S3 Bucket was used to retrieve information about the design such as templates and hosted payment page session. Used SignalR libraries to process and interact with the target application in realtime following messages published through AWS SQS and SNS topics. Used Cloudwatch and XRAY to log annotations, debug information for the requests, created Cloudwatch custom dashboards that filters the logs on priority level, introduced centralised logging mechanism using Cloudwatch streams.

Commercial experience in deployment pipelines such as Github, SourceTree, Bitbucket, Teamcity, Octopus and cloud deployment services like AWS Code Pipeline with support of powershell scripts.

Skills: C#, Dotnet Core, AWS API Gateway, AWS Lambda Functions, AWS Cloudformation, Dynamo DB, Entity Framework, LINQ, JSON, SIGNAL R, RESTFUL, HTML, MVC, SQL Server, Oracle, T-SQL, Redis, DynamoDB AWS, Dapper, Razor, Console Applications, Windows Applications, Web Applications, CSS, LESS, SASS, Javascript, Jquery, Vue JS, Babel, WebPack, ES6, Web Services, OAUTH, AWS Cognito, Web APIS, ASP.NET CORE,TeamCity
salesLead.title: Founder & AI Engineer
salesLead.titleDescription: Tonzo, as the founder of the project I was responsible for all the parts of the project, invented an AI module written in Phyton and used AWS Sagemaker instances to score the customer reviews based on their quality, the purpose of the module was to potentially detect fraud reviews and populate an impartial evalution of the reviews usin AI technology, the module used many mathematical algorithms to calculate the quality score, the algorithms used but not limited to were Sequence to Sequence, Naive Byes, N-Gram Analysis, location of the reviewer, and other factors. The web application and the WEB API were written in C# using Firebase as authorizer. The AI module had an interest from an AI company based in Belgium and we have agreed for the acquisition of the AI module only (I still have the rights to use it in the UK). The platform is still active and reachable on https://uk.tonzo.com with 360K+ registered businesses (free). The platform is stable and I have stopeed working on it. The tech stack were used in the platform Cloudflare, AWS (Elastic Beanstalk, SQS, Lambda Functions, S3, IAM roles, EC2), C#, PostgreSQL with POSTGIS extension, used Dapper as object–relational mapping, Dotnet Core 6.0 as I prefer to work on LTS versions. Followed TDD approach and created unit tests with NUNIT. Used BDD frameworks like Cucumber(Specflow) and Selenium.

jobs.jobTitle: Solutions Architect / C# MVC & API Developer
jobs.description: Council Ratings - I was responsible for the whole infrastructure , web application (MVC, C#, .Net Core 6.0, Dapper, Specflow, XUNIT, Selenium, PostgreSQL, POSTGIS), Restful api and mobile application. Created and delivered the application by using the same stack as I have stated above and experienced Flutter (cross native mobile application development) as my first commercial app in live Google Play link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.councilratings.app, IOS link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/council-ratings/id6443605891.

Adflex provides payment solutions to DHL, Morrisons and many more huge clients, the company was still using legacy SOAP APIs and I was assigned to create a RestFul API following the latest OWASP security standards in AWS environment using API Gateway + Lambda functions (used Dapper as object–relational mapping) + Cognito as Authorizer and JWT to handle authorization. The project was delivered successfully and it is still in use, I also created a ResFul API Documentation using NODE + Swagger UI which generates code samples for every language. Experienced BitBucket + Teamcity + Octopus Deploy and AWS CodePipeline to deploy some of the functions we have used. Cloudformation templates were used as infrastructure as code feature. Created a Postman collection for developers to interact and understand the RestFul API models and authorization stages. Introduced a mechanism to prevent replay attacks on the API by using REDIS. I was also involved with the website development of the company, and implemented SEO techniques (on-page only) on their website, they were being ranked higher after the completion of the website. For some features of the applications we have used DynamoDB as our datasource. I was also assigned to create a javascript library (NodeJS, ES6) where customers could place the generated code on their wep application to display secure hosted payment page. Followed TDD approach and created unit tests with NUNIT. Used BDD frameworks like Cucumber(Specflow) and Selenium.

BMF provides loans for consumers via car dealers, and I was assigned to create a software (C#, ASP.NET MVC + MS SQL Server + AWS) for dealers to make credit applications on behalf of consumers and view the application outcome in the dashboard. Proposed to use an event driven architecture instead of monolithic, used Lambda functions with SQS and SNS features to message our internal SIGNALR hub and handling the message no the browser, the database was also designed by myself and implemented many stored procedures, functions eg. Our team consisted of DevOps and experienced Github + Teamcity + Octopus Deploy, created the project in Teamcity and used deployment templated in Octopus, with environment variables. The software is still in use by BMF and they were pleased with the outcome. I was also involved in internal Dealer Support System project, and delivered the internal app where regional managers used to send applications to head office by uploading documents, providing information, the tech stack were similar C#, MS SQL Server, AWS. Followed TDD approach and created unit tests with XUNIT but I am also capable to use NUNIT. Integrated authentication mechanism with OKTA.
Implemented many web applications using .net framework with C# + MVC + HTML5 + jQuery, followed TDD approach. The MS SQL database were used using entity framework as ORM.

ASPX + C# + MS SQL + HTML + SEO

salesLead.name: Anna Koroleva
salesLead.summary:
I am a computational linguist holding a PhD in Natural Language Processing. I have 9 years of research and industrial experience in NLP. I have worked on a wide set of tasks, ranging from tokenisation and stemming to entity and relation extraction, text classification and building knowledge graphs from texts. I have experience with rule-based, statistical and machine learning methods in NLP. I have extensive experience with text annotation, preparing annotation guidelines, and annotation quality assurance.

One of my main professional passions is AI for Good and, in particular, applying NLP in the healthcare domain. I worked in biomedical NLP for several years and completed a PhD project devoted to detecting “spin” (unjustified positive presentation of clinical trial results) in biomedical articles. My PhD thesis can be found at https://dare.uva.nl/search?identifier=f25c8dc7-3bf3-4fb9-be2d-c456681b4291, and the original source code at https://github.com/aakorolyova/DeSpin. I am currently working on a new and improved version of the code that can be found here: https://github.com/aakorolyova/DeSpin-2.0. Besides, I’m an active member of Omdena AI for Good community (https://omdena.com), having participated in 3 challenges as a Machine Learning Engineer and in 1 challenge as the Product Owner.

Another area that has recently sparked my interest is Conversation Design. I participated in two AI challenges devoted to developing chatbots (read a blog about it at https://omdena.com/blog/how-to-build-a-chatbot-using-rasa/). 

Yet another passion of mine is multi-lingual NLP. Apart from English, I speak Russian (my mother tongue), French, Italian (have not practiced for a while but used to have level B1), currently learning German. I had introductory half-a-year courses of Hungarian, Estonian and Esperanto. It just feels to me that limiting the scope of work to English is so... well, limiting! In one of my previous jobs, I used to manage a team of linguists developing NLP tools for English, Russian, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, Arabic - that was challenging but so much fun!

I am proficient in Python and have good knowledge of machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow and Scikit-learn. I am experienced in NLP libraries such as NLTK, spaCy, stanza, Huggihgface's transformers.

My GitHub profile: https://github.com/aakorolyova

salesLead.name: Paolo Di Prodi
salesLead.summary:
Goal: to provide robotic solutions for security, personal care and education.
My primary research area is related to computational neuroscience and how information is processed in the cortical network of the brain. These models are then reduced and implemented in embodied solutions like robots, electronic devices and software programs. In this way self-organization is achieved at different scales from the microscopic level (ion-channels, neural networks) to the macroscopic scales like swarm systems. Swarm systems self-organise themselves using local interactions and communication but what plays an important role is the processing of the information. 
Swarm systems can then applied to solve different tasks like automatic surveillance, personal care and assisted learning. 
A mix of networked sensors –bio, vision, and audio sensors- can be fused together with prosthesis to monitor a human subject and assist him in daily tasks including walking, pharmaceutical schedule assumptions or body regulation like insulin.
There’s a great potential in this approach that must be pursued for the sake of humanity.

Specialties: Artificial intelligence, embedded systems, network sensors, autonomous robots: UGV and UAV.

salesLead.summary:
Dr Adam Sroka, Director of Hypercube Consulting, is an experienced data and AI leader helping organisations unlock value from data by delivering enterprise-scale solutions and building high-performing data and analytics teams from the ground up. Adam shares his thoughts and ideas through public speaking, tech community events, on his blog, and in his podcast.

Many organisations aren't getting the most out of their data and many data professionals struggle to communicate their results or the complexity and value of their work in a way that business stakeholders can relate to. Being able to understand both the technology and how it translates to real benefits is key.

Simply hiring the most capable people often isn’t enough. The solution is a mix of clear and explicit communication, strong fundamentals and engineering discipline, and an appetite to experiment and iterate to success quickly. 

If this is something you’re struggling with - either as an organisation finding its feet with data and AI or as a data professional - the approaches and systems Adam has developed over his career will be able to help so please reach out.

Cutting-edge data technologies are redefining every industry and adopting these new ways of working can be difficult and frustrating. One day, there will be best practices and playbooks for how to maximise the value from your data and teams, but until then Adam is eager to share his experiences in both business and data and shed some light on what works.

Want to see how the Disperse solution can drive deliverability and reduce your overhead costs?

Disperse gives construction project teams performance data and actionable insights that drive better business decisions. In order to succeed in the industry, general contractors must meet stakeholder expectations.

Project management teams need access to the right data in order to keep a project moving forward.  But instead, they are drip-fed data from manual, onsite reports. Reports that are prone to inaccuracies. Reports that take up time and reduce productivity.

So how do construction firms resolve this? 

By leveraging a building productivity platform that provides accurate, objective data in a matter of minutes.

Enter Disperse. 

Our award-winning platform is a unique combination of hybrid AI technology that tracks what matters and provides reports that are scalable, accurate, and reliable. We detect impending issues through our 360-degree camera technology that allows teams to track what is happening at a construction site at any time, from any place.

salesLead.name: Brendan Ruff
salesLead.pastExperienceCompanyTitle: Technical director and lead computer vision research engineer
salesLead.summary:
I come from a real-time embedded computer vision background and machine learning and AI, ( in particular AGI ) with 37 years track record. In 2015 I focused on AI based vision using deep neural nets and spent some time rebuilding the basics of the science and technology to understand the limitations and find alternative solutions. Since then I have moved on to develop a combined bottom-up visual perception with top-down cognitive context within an adaptive inference approach that is computationally efficient and sparse via task-based attention. Along the way I developed a working theory of mind and an entirely new neuro-connectionist approach to AGI which I am always happy to discuss.

Some of my main interests are AGI, object-centric representations, 3D computer vision, cognitive architectures, and embedded computing and electronics. I code in C++ for efficient applications and Python for rapid prototyping using PyTorch nowadays . I have built tech teams and managed projects including cloud based AI deployment. However, I prefer to self-start and just manage my own technical work and direction. I am a creative innovator bringing a multi-disciplinary approach to problem solving combining math, physics, computer science, computer vision, AI, AGI, embedded computing, and even microelectronics to solve problems, create new concepts and products, and quickly discover the right path by assessing risks early. I have specified and developed many CV based innovative products over the last 3 decades since leaving academia and government research, and I am as comfortable in stakeholder facing situations as coding or other technical development.

I typically develop using Visual Studio on Windows though I also am working on the nVidia Jetson embedded platform ( Orin ), coding in C++, user interfaces using C# and Windows Forms with some cloud micro-service development, and deep neural network development using Pytorch/Python. I have developed extensively on embedded platforms from bare metal upwards including bringing up peripherals, OS, and storage devices, and USB.

Over the last decade I have had many projects in the automotive space relating to object detection, semantic segmentation, and 3D reconstruction. One particular area of interest is adaptive multi-scale neural networks for detect-and-track that greatly reduces the computational load. After all, why process pixels you don't need or irrelevant details at high res?
salesLead.title: independent computer vision + AI + cognitive architectures R&D engineer
salesLead.titleDescription:
I founded DeepSee AI in 2016 as a subcontractor for the newly developing field of neural network based visual perception, and it has been a busy six years! Earlier in this role I was heavily into automotive prototypes including semantic segmentation, monocular 3D reconstruction, and novel approaches to object instance detection as well as improving the basic science for training of deep neural networks. Nowadays my passion is combined cognition and perception within a new neuro-connectionist approach that is based upon what I call quasi-symbolic reasoning that I believe is the future of AI+AGI as it is both efficient and general purpose.

Mainly I work with C++ and CUDA for performance applications and I have a big interest in nVidia Orin SOM. For deep nets research I code with Python + Pytorch or other deep learning framework and have 6 years of building my own code libraries. I prefer to develop UI in C# and call into C++/CLI middleware dotnet libs on top of platform independent C++ code/libs, as C# is great for UI and very fast compared to Python, and allows true concurrent threading.

I prefer R&D into next gen science and technology, particularly visual perception and cognition, whether on desktop or embedded / IoT. I am equally at home with engineering efficient solutions. As an in-house project since 2018, I have been developing an alternative to backprop trained deep neural nets that combines visual perception and cognition seamlessly and is aimed at an agent learning through self-direction much like a human, and generalizing much like a human. In principle, this allows the agent to bring its skills into a new task such as driving a vehicle, and I believe this is the only way that autonomous driving will be safe. As a side-effect, the cognitive agent is ( in principle ) able to describe what it is doing and how it reached its decisions via natural language. Another benefit is the capability to recruit external knowledge and skills just like a human.

salesLead.name: Rob Beavan MIET
salesLead.summary:
You made it this far, so thank you!

“Only a few find the way, some don’t recognize it when they do – some… don’t ever want to.” - Cheshire Cat

I'm a Husband (of one), Father (of three) and Primary Ablution Technician and Feed Supplier (of two canines).  I'm edging towards that half-century and have attracted the monicker "Boomer" from the kids, but am yet to find out why I link with nuclear submarines...

Describing myself as a pessimistic optimist, I endeavour to seek out the humorous aspects of any given situation and have been known, on occasion, to make people chuckle - sometimes intentionally.

I have many more interests than free time allows ranging from reading, electronics, board games, snoozing, movies, cryptography, writing, puzzles and music.

I'm the Senior Process Engineer at Mondelez International in Marlbrook, near Leominster, Herefordshire, where my role is to ensure that all aspects of the manufacturing plant are optimised and controlled in order to produce a consistently great Cadbury's Chocolate product for the consumer in a safe and efficient manner.

I have over 20 years experience in engineering where I have learnt what partial electrocution feels like and how not to wire transformers, as well as professional engineering practices and maintenance strategies (no electrocution involved). I have been lead engineer on high level process maintenance, (PLCs and SCADA systems) involved in new plant installation, scoping and site acceptance of equipment, ran a Utilities and Production Maintenance dept. and have also headed up an Engineering Team that ensured the safe and efficient operation of pharmaceutical packaging machinery.

Outside of Engineering, I am fortunate to have just shy of 10 years experience working in a unique National Security environment. Being technically minded I proved particularly adept at working with technical communities and analyst communities to achieve desired aims - kind of like a 6 foot Babelfish that allowed communication to take place between people whose minds were too active and busy to allow room for ordinary interaction and a customer set like Oliver Twist (always asking for more). I was lucky enough to travel the World in this job and have had some amazing experiences and met some incredibly interesting and talented people along the way.

None of the things I've stated above are who I am, though they have helped define and shape me. 

I'm neurodiverse and love to learn and firmly believe that the me today is not the same me as yesterday because of this.

Let's connect and learn from each other!
